image.altText: Tony Burke in front of flags.

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke rebukes the Israeli prime minister's attack on Anthony Albanese as he defends the decision to cancel the visa of a member of Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition.

title.children: Strength not about 'how many people you can blow up': Australia rebukes Israeli PM

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with his chin up and Benjamin Netanyahu with his mouth slightly open. Flags behind each

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese joins a growing club of prime ministers and presidents personally berated by Benjamin Netanyahu, who is finding himself increasingly isolated on the world stage.

title.children: Netanyahu's criticism of Albanese is following a familiar playbook

image.altText: Daryl Maguire wearing a blue suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Daryl Maguire has been handed a jail sentence of 10 months for giving misleading evidence to the NSW corruption watchdog.

title.children: Breaking: Former MP jailed for 10 months for giving misleading evidence at ICAC

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann holds an umbrella while walking.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann was found to have raped Brittany Higgins on the balance of probabilities. Today, his appeal against that ruling begins in the Federal Court.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against defamation case begins

image.altText: Jim Chalmers at economic rountable

props.synopsis: The treasurer is positive some "win-wins" can be found as the government's economic roundtable turns its focus to regulation, approvals and artificial intelligence. Follow live.

title.children: Chalmers confident of 'win-wins' on day two of economic roundtable

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Chalmers eyes off 'win-wins' on day two of economic reform roundtable
'Strength is not measured by how many people you blow up': Burke hits back at Netanyahu
Productivity summit turns focus to building homes

image.altText: Tradies work on the roof frame of a new home under construction.

props.synopsis: Housing will dominate discussion at the Economic Reform Roundtable this morning, with ministers, business leaders and conservationists all under pressure to solve the wicked problem of building more homes without trashing the environment.

title.children: Freeze on construction rules on cards amid warnings housing goal will fail

image.altText: A woman and man inspect a black t-shirt on a mannequin

props.synopsis: Australian fashion brands that are stocked in the US are wearing the burden of the higher tariffs on Chinese made goods. And as uncertainty continues, some brands are walking away from the lucrative market.

title.children: The Australian business pulling out of the US as shipping in 'chaos'

image.altText: Signage is seen for Monash IVF in Clayton, Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The review was launched following unrelated cases of embryo mix-ups in Brisbane and Melbourne, which were reported this year

title.children: Review into Monash IVF embryo mix-ups to remain secret

image.altText: A side-on shot of an e-scooter on a path in a bike rack outside Bentley Plaza in Perth, with shoppers in the background.

props.synopsis: WA Police are placing e-scooters outside shopping centres for people to steal, in a "proactive" operation that one human rights advocate says is inducing disadvantaged people to commit crime.

title.children: 'Sounds like entrapment': Man steals e-scooter placed at shops by police

image.altText: dozens of make shift tents on dirt land with destroyed buildings behind them.

props.synopsis: By stitching together the so-called "evacuation orders" issued by the Israel Defense Forces, it is possible to see just how much of Gaza Israel has already taken.

title.children: IDF displacement orders suggest Israel's ultimate plan for Gaza

image.altText: two hands, handing over keys between them.

props.synopsis: After relying on a buyer's agent for expert advice, a "blindsided" Sydney couple discovers their investment property has costly hidden problems.

title.children: Blindsided investors say buyer's agent did not inspect property in person

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is likely to edge higher despite a sell-off across Nvidia and other US tech stocks overnight, while the Reserve Bank of New Zealand is expected to deliver another interest rate cut. Follow live.

title.children: ASX to recover as tech slump drags Wall Street lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX falls 0.2 per cent in morning trade
Monash IVF shares rise as investigation to remain concealed
Coffee machine sales boost Breville's profit

image.altText: Elderly Caucasian-looking man, slight smile, teeth showing, thinning hair combed back, grey temples, suit, tie, blue background.

props.synopsis: The death of an accused paedophile, once a respected community leader, has left scores of alleged victims suing the State of New South Wales over child sexual abuse dating back decades.

title.children: Late former mayor linked to scores of child sex abuse civil claims

image.altText: A woman sits in a dark room holding a picture of her with her husband.

props.synopsis: An Australian-first trial using psychedelic-assisted therapy for terminally ill patients is showing promising results.

title.children: How a magic mushroom compound is helping people face the terror of dying

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a meeting table.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's allies work on plans for security guarantees for the war-torn country as the US president rules out putting American boots on the ground.

title.children: Trump rules out sending troops into Ukraine as allies consider security guarantees

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair wearing a navy blue shirt and woman with short dark hair standing together.

props.synopsis: Residents in a small central Queensland town are campaigning to get their full GP service back amid fears the area could lose another doctor.

title.children: Country doctor makes tough decision to cut back appointments

image.altText: 4 male politicians in suits and four female politicians in red and pink blazers stand in a row in parliament.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Labor Party is meeting this morning to vote on leadership positions after the party's election defeat was confirmed yesterday.

title.children: Tasmanian Labor MPs meet to discuss new leadership

image.altText: Police officers gathered on a street

props.synopsis: Witnesses have told police the man was shot while getting into his car at Winston Hills in Sydney's west on Tuesday evening.

title.children: 22yo dies after being shot while sat in car in Sydney's west

image.altText: A woman is standing up looking at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Former childcare workers at a centre where a man is alleged to have sexually assaulted two children speak out about a culture of secrecy in the centres.

title.children: Goodstart workers 'disgusted' with childcare complaints handling in abuse case

image.altText: A woman has long brown hair, she looks solemn. She wears earrings which read "stop violence against women"

props.synopsis: Advocates and people with lived experience have welcomed the findings of South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence, but say it's now up to the state government to reform the system.

title.children: Findings of SA royal commission welcomed by survivors and advocates

image.altText: A sign marks The Wesley Hospital.

props.synopsis: Rosemarie Campbell, who died three days after having gastric bypass surgery, was described as a dedicated grandmother during a coronial inquest into her death in Brisbane.

title.children: Patient told husband she thought surgery was 'mistake' before death

image.altText: A white woman with brown hair touches the side of her face as she poses for a photo

props.synopsis: Actor Aubrey Plaza speaks for the first time about the sudden death of her husband, Jeff Baena, saying her life has become a daily struggle.

title.children: 'Daily struggle': Aubrey Plaza speaks about husband's death

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell smile for a photo, with Jeffrey’s arm around Ghislaine’s shoulder

props.synopsis: The Justice Department has agreed to provide Congress some documents from the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation, though it is unclear exactly which or how many documents might be produced.

title.children: Some Jeffrey Epstein files to be released to Congress, House member says

image.altText: An elderly woman sitting at a table wearing a blue jacket and white shirt underneath.

props.synopsis: The last remaining banking branch is about to close its doors in this regional town, leaving older Australians and businesses stranded.

title.children: Banks accused of taking people's 'independence away' via closures

image.altText: Year 6 girl and boy sitting in dark blue school uniform on a brown sofa

props.synopsis: One in five of the students admitted to NSW's prestigious selective schools this year came from disadvantaged groups, but ABC analysis shows that the schools one expert calls the "jewel in the crown" of NSW education remain the domain of privileged students.

title.children: Areas of Sydney where most selective high school applications come from

image.altText: Royal Darwin Hospital Intensive Care Unit

props.synopsis: The controversial Acacia system will be switched on at Alice Springs and Tennant Creek hospitals on Saturday, despite lingering doubts about the project's safety.

title.children: 'Unsafe' patient record system to go live at two NT hospitals

image.altText: A closeup of stethoscope resting on a doctor's chest.

props.synopsis: Australia's rural health crisis is deepening as internationally trained doctors face delays, with bureaucracy and lack of available supervisors blocking workforce solutions.

title.children: Authorities defend approach on overseas GPs as country vacancies continue

image.altText: A koala is sitting on rocks near a cliff's edge with water in the background

props.synopsis: The young male, found at the base of a cliff at Wategos Beach, is in hospital after ingesting seawater, rescuers say, in a sign the animals are struggling to cling to shrinking habitat.

title.children: Rescuers say Byron Bay koala plucked from rocks had fallen into sea

image.altText: Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori celebrate winning a point in a mixed doubles tennis match

props.synopsis: Defending US Open mixed doubles champions Andrea Vavassori and Sara Errani are through to the semifinals of the re-imagined format.

title.children: Defending champs trump singles stars to reach US Open mixed doubles semis

image.altText: A piece of slow-cooked lamb in a pot alongside lemon, fennel, potatoes and juices, topped with fresh green herbs.

props.synopsis: The cost of a lamb leg in the shops has nearly doubled in the past 18 months as the drought bites.

title.children: Traditional lamb roast out of reach for many families as prices double

image.altText: A person in shadow walks through a caged internal courtyard covered in more shadows.

props.synopsis: A new report has revealed isolations at South Australia's only youth detention centre increased by 50 per cent during a period last year and has questioned the legality of their use, with one respondent saying they felt they were being "punished like a dog".

title.children: 'Punished like a dog': Report reveals increase in isolations at SA youth detention centre

image.altText: A deceased turtle on a rock

props.synopsis: Wildlife carers are investigating after turtles with unusual symptoms washed ashore at several popular swimming spots north of Newcastle.

title.children: Dozens of dead turtles with bleeding eyes wash up on NSW beaches

image.altText: a man sits close to a webcam in a turtle neck jumper

props.synopsis: The Saudi-born suspect faces charges of murder and attempted murder after allegedly driving his SUV into a crowded market in the city of Magdeburg.

title.children: Over 300 charges levelled at alleged German Christmas market attacker

image.altText: The outside of a premises with a blue banner reading "health clinic and pharmacy" "cohealth"

props.synopsis: This community health organisation is having to cancel appointments when it rains, as the roof leaks, making rooms uninhabitable.

title.children: Poor infrastructure forcing community health appointment cancellations

image.altText: A close up of plant species in two jars with white cloth on top.

props.synopsis: Researchers say it’s like Han Solo from Star Wars coming out from carbon freezing, but doing it for plants.

title.children: How cryopreservation is being used to save critically endangered tree
